task_description: Facing the building to your West (approx. 272°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full vertical extent of the main building (base to roofline), so I should tilt the camera upward while keeping the same heading.
I’m now facing north instead of west, so I should rotate left to re-align with the target building to the west while keeping the upward pitch to capture its top.
To estimate height I need the roofline in view, so I should tilt up while staying aimed at the building to the west.
The view snapped back to north again, so I must rotate left to face west toward the target building while keeping the upward pitch.
The interface keeps resetting pitch/heading after rotations, so I should do a single rotation that both faces west and tilts up to capture the building’s top in one view.
I need to be facing west to see the target building, so rotate left 90° and keep the current upward pitch.
To estimate the building height reliably I should move closer to get clearer facade details (floors/windows) for scaling, while staying oriented west.
After moving my heading is now near north, so I should rotate left to approximately 273° to face the target building again.
I should tilt up to include the roofline while keeping the base in view enough to judge number of stories.
I’m again facing north; I need to rotate left to face west while maintaining the current upward pitch to see the building top.
Since rotations are not persisting pitch as expected, I should instead stop and provide a best estimate based on the visible building’s apparent 3-story height typical of campus/office blocks.
